alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Muskegon; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 11 at 6:59PM EDT until September 12 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds will increase rapidly through the course of the evening. Waves will build significantly reaching the 6 to 10 foot range. Waves of this height are dangerous to all swimmers. Dangerous conditions will continue into the overnight hours. Stay dry when waves are high!
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
